chapterTitle: Financial Leverage and Capital Structure Policy

columns.text:
$a)$ First, we have to find out the earnings per share of normal economic which we denote with $EP$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*}
EP&=\frac{EI}{CS}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{29,000}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=3.918
\end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share of nominal economic are $\boxed{3.918}$

We have to find out the earnings per share of expansion economic which we denote with $EE$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$, percent higher $PH$ is $30\%$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*}
EE&=\frac{EI \times(1+PH)}{CS}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{29,000 \times(1+30\%)}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{29,000 \times (1+0.3)}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{29,000 \times 1.3}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{37,700}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=5.09
\end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share of expansion economic are $\boxed{5.09}$

We have to find out the earnings per share of recession economic which we denote with $ER$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$, percent decrease $PD$ is $40\%$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*}
EP&=\frac{ER \times(1-PD)}{CS}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{29,000 \times(1-40\%)}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{29,000 \times (1-0.4)}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{29,000 \times 0.6}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{17,400}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=2.35
\end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share of recession economic are $\boxed{2.35}$

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share which we denote with $PE$, where the earnings per share of expansion economic  $EE$ is $5.09$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EP$ is $3.918$

$$\begin{align*}
PE&=\frac{EE-EP}{EP}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{5.09-3.918}{3.918}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{1.172}{3.918}\\[12pt]
&=0.2991\\[7pt]
&=29.91\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share is $\boxed{29.91\%}$

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share from normal to recession which we denote with $PER$, where the earnings per share of recession economic  $ER$ is $2.35$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EP$ is $3.918$

$$\begin{align*}
PER&=\frac{ER-EP}{EP}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{2.35-3.918}{3.918}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{-1.568}{3.918}\\[12pt]
&=-0.4002\\[7pt]
&=-40.02\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share from normal to recession is $\boxed{-40.02\%}$

$b)$ Second, we have to find out the actual price per share which we denote with $AP$, where the total market value $TV$ is $185,000$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*}
AP&=\frac{TV}{CS}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{185,000}{7,400}\\[12pt]
&=\$25
\end{align*}$$

So, actual price per share is $\boxed{\$25}$

We have to find out the actual shares repurchased which we denote with $ASR$, where the debt issue $D$ is $65,000$ and the actual price per share $AP$ is $\$25$

$$\begin{align*}
ASR&=\frac{D}{AP}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{65,000}{25}\\[12pt]
&=2,600
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual shares repurchased is $\boxed{2,600}$

We have to find out the interest expenses which we denote with $IE$, where the interest rate $IR$ is $7\%$ and the debt issue $D$ is $65,000$ 

$$\begin{align*}
IE&=IR \times D\\[7pt]
&=7\%\times 65,000\\[7pt]
&=0.07 \times 65,000\\[7pt]
&=4,550
\end{align*}$$

So, the interest expenses is $\boxed{\$4,550}$

We have to find out the net income of nominal condition which we denote with $NIN$, where the  earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$ and the interest expenses $IE$ is $\$4,550$

$$\begin{align*}
NIN&=EI-IE\\[7pt]
&=29,000-4,550\\[7pt]
&=\$24,450
\end{align*}$$

So, the net income of nominal condition is $\boxed{\$24,450}$

We have to find out the net income of expansion condition which we denote with $NIE$, where the  earnings before interest and taxes expansion $EI$ is $\$37.,700$ and the interest expenses $IE$ is $\$4,550$

$$\begin{align*}
NIE&=EI-IE\\[7pt]
&=37,700-4,550\\[7pt]
&=\$33,150
\end{align*}$$

So, the net income of expansion condition is $\boxed{\$33,150}$

We have to find out the net income of recession condition which we denote with $NIR$, where the  earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$17,400$ and the interest expenses $IE$ is $\$4,550$

$$\begin{align*}
NIR&=EI-IE\\[7pt]
&=17,400-4,550\\[7pt]
&=\$12,850
\end{align*}$$

So, the net income of recession condition is $\boxed{\$12,850}$

We have to find out the earnings per share under the nominal economic condition which we denote with $EN$, where the net income of nominal condition $NIN$ is $\$24,450$, currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$ and the actual shares repurchased $ASR$ is $2,600$

$$\begin{align*}
EN&=\frac{NIN}{CS-ASR}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{24,450}{7,400-2,600}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{24,450}{4,800}\\[12pt]
&=5.09
\end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share under the nominal economic condition is $\boxed{\$5.09}$

We have to find out the earnings per share under the expansion economic condition which we denote with $EE$, where the net income of expansion condition $NIE$ is $\$33,150$, currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$ and the actual shares repurchased $ASR$ is $2,600$

$$\begin{align*}
EE&=\frac{NIE}{CS-ASR}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{33,150}{7,400-2,600}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{33,150}{4,800}\\[12pt]
&=6.90
\end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share under the expansion economic condition is $\boxed{\$6.90}$

We have to find out the earnings per share under the recession economic condition which we denote with $ER$, where the net income of recession condition $NIR$ is $\$12,850$, currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$ and the actual shares repurchased $ASR$ is $2,600$

$$\begin{align*}
ER&=\frac{NIR}{CS-ASR}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{12,850}{7,400-2,600}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{12,850}{4,800}\\[12pt]
&=2.67
\end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share under the recession economic condition is $\boxed{\$2.67}$

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to expansion which we denote with $PE$, where the earnings per share of expansion economic  $EE$ is $6.90$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EN$ is $5.09$

$$\begin{align*}
PE&=\frac{EE-EN}{EN}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{6.90-5.09}{5.09}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{1.81}{5.09}\\[12pt]
&=0.3555\\[7pt]
&=35.55\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to expansion  is $\boxed{35.55\%}$

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to the recession which we denote with $PR$, where the earnings per share of recession economic  $ER$ is $2.67$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EN$ is $5.09$

$$\begin{align*}
PR&=\frac{ER-EN}{EN}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{2.67-5.09}{5.09}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{-2.42}{5.09}\\[12pt]
&=-0.4754\\[7pt]
&=-47.54\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to recession is $\boxed{-47.54\%}$
